"Now in the old days
the myths and the stories were used to explain ourselves
But how can we explain the way we hate ourselves
The things weâve made ourselves
Into the way we break ourselves
Into the way we over-complicate ourselves..

But we are still mythical
We are still permanently trapped
Somewhere between the heroic and the pitiful
We are still Godly
Thatâs whatâs made us so monstrous
But it feels like weâve forgotten
That we are much more than the sum of the things
that belong to us

Every single person has a purpose in them, burning
Look again
Allow yourself to see
Them
Millions of characters
Each with their own epic narratives.."

Now I don't want to say I am sorry because i actually don't want to ask for forgiveness becaus I don't think it's fair either. And I don't think you should have to have to deal with this. It isn't fair. And I dont want to do this to you. So I am sorry because I am sorry to hurt you. I am sorry for making you feel bad. I don't want that ever and that kills me and right now it feels like my insides are consumed by black smoke, just dry and black and ugly.
I am sorry for all of the negativity I cause.
This I'm sorry does not mean 'forgive me'. I don't have the face to ask for that and I don't want that because it's wrong. I'm wrong.

None of this makes up for the fact of my not replying to you for so long.
It doesn't and I'm sorry but I'm sorry doesn't mean anything -  if we were in the same place, I don't think I could say I am sorry to you looking you in the eyes because it doesn't fix anything, it doesn't make up for anything, it doesn't change me and it doesn't change how shitty I am to do this kind of thing. 
All that I can say (and it's isn't enough) is that it gets out of my control. I get all entangled in my head. Like I'm at the bottom of an ocean and there's heavy stones in my shoes (Virginia Woolf) and I see you above the water but I can't swim up to speak to you. And I have all these things that I want to say, and I say them in my head and I am so fucking anxious to get them to you but I can't because there's these stones in my shoes and I just can't swim up I can't.
That's what happens. That's how it feels each day I don't talk to you and you look for me and it feels like that when I wake up, it feels like that on the bus on the way to work, it feels like that when I am in the middle of a conversation with somebody else, it feels like that as I lie back down to sleep but I don't know how to fix it.
I try. I am trying and I'll always try. But sometimes I can't stop it I still don't have complete control of this and it happens.

On top of that I most aggravating is the fact that I am now in the deepest mud of self-doubt and fear and I can't get my head out of it. I'm scared to leave. I'm scared I won't ever be able to find I place in which I can function and be at peace and happy (as fucking bland as that sounds). I wasn't before but I am now. And so I am scared of quitting this fucking job that I know I am not content with but which, at the most delusional moments and in these moments of fear and self-doubt I fool myself into believing is actually ok. But it is not okay because it is not all that I want to be. But what do I wan to be? I don't know. It's all very cliche and feels extremely silly to talk about but I don't know how to get over it and I don't know what to do about it.

So it starts with the fact that I don't know when I am going to be free from work which makes it impossible for me to actually make concrete plans. And which fucks things up because you need this information to make yours plans and I think everything is up in the air and gone. But I don't want it to be up in the air and gone, so I have been trying to get a different answer for the past two weeks but the truth is that I won't be able to have one. 
The initial finish date I had was August 20th but I think that there is no way that that is going to happen, and it will be September only - at the earliest. But I don't know that for sure either.
So what kind of conversation can we have? This is incrediby frustrating - it fucks eveything up.
And lightly lightly lightly I keep repeating it and but I can't these days>

Fuck I am so sorry. I have tried writing to you so many times over the past few weeks. This is the second attempt today. It is very difficult to talk to you when I can't come to terms with myself. Because I cannot find a voice to speak in. This is an issue that I don't know if I will be able to get into now. I am trying still to untangle it in my head.

I didnât want to alarm you with my voice messages. Please keep in mind that often I tend to be quite impulsive and I was in a very negative mindset when I sent them to you.
I also did mention right away to sort of scratch out what Iâd said and was trying to express the frustration that I feel with out situation.
And most importantly, I believe it is ridiculous that you would automatically assume that it has to do with âdecisions that you have madeâ or that it is in any way there is blame that just be assigned to one side or the other/// Life has brought you where itâs brought you and life has brought me where itâs brought me; it is not in our power to decide what we are doing in order to bring ourselves at the height of our personal aspirations because that is what this is. It seems perfectly logical and simultaneously absurd to think that if we wish for our presence to be constant in each othersâ lives that we should veer our paths towards each other and I think that our relationship never entailed that; we always happened to live in the same city for a while and weâre near to each other regardless of our personal decision making. I explain al of this to try and get out of your silly head that somehow the reason why we are separate at the moment has to do with decisions that you have made yourself. We are both still learning and we are both still attempting to mould things in our lives to understand better how to navigate them in the directions we wish to do so. 
Itâs a strange deadlock and it is one free of responsibility; it just happened, as it would and we both find ourselves in it. 

That is why I think we should seek to spend time together this summer again and for a longer period of time; and enjoy it fully for what it is. So much time has passed since we have taken part in each othersâ lives quotidian that sometimes I wonder if the magic of our relationship would flake slightly if it actually happened in the moment we forced it. So I will bring myself back to the mystical seed of our connection and say that yes, letâs make an effort to see each other soon, savour it and stop the desire or imaginations that we have of what it would be like if we were to be in the same city and let the hunger rise again in another moment in which I believe we will be able to make more concrete decisions to bring us to being in the same place at the same time. 

Am I making sense?
Iâd like to be able to disentangle you from the self-deprecation that sometimes you express and feelâ¦. Please free yourself of responsibilities that you have claimed as your ownâ¦ I donât know how many times I will express this. 

I am glad that you have decided to stop your job. You have, indeed, been repeating for far too long the fatigue with which you execute it, and with a little bit more experience under my belt I feel that I can now say to you that if you have stopped learning and have stopped enjoying what you are doing then fucking change things and do what you felt and feel like you need to do. But actually do it. 
Maybe you needed to bring yourself to these limits in order to understand this, or to bring yourself to finally do what genuinely fills you, inspires you and makes you happy. Try to browse through your history and remember the times at which you have peaked in your positive frame of mind and know that you have the instruments already to veer yourself towards that frame of mind again. The last time I saw you there was a layer of strength, confidence and security that wasnât there before and I know that you have the strength and verve to enhance it even more.

"At every moment, behind the most efficient seeming adult exterior, the whole world of the personâs childhood is being carefully held like a glass of water bulging above the brim. And in fact, that child is the only real thing in them. Itâs their humanity, their real individuality, the one that canât understand why it was born and that knows it will have to die, in no matter how crowded a place, quite on its own. Thatâs the carrier of all the living qualities. Itâs the centre of all the possible magic and revelation. What doesnât come out of that creature isnât worth having, or itâs worth having only as a tool â for that creature to use and turn to account and make meaningful..."

I want to share this with you because it informs what i truly believe needs to be all connection between human beings.

Also. i believe that you are a beautiful beautiful child and you are one of the few people that i know who i think are brave enough to navigate the world with their inner child on the frontline. I don't know if you will agree. But it's what i see/feel and I had never been able to pinpoint and understand why i feel the way i feel when i am around you, but i think this is why.
Do get to the end of the excerpt from the letter, as it is very very very much worth it.

I just felt I needed to tell you. There is no need to worry. It was just a bad trip. I will write to you soon. Things were hard the last few days.

I came to SÃ£o Paulo on Friday.
Saturday was a friend's birthday party and Milly, the girl I was sort of seeing before travelling went and we hung out and it was nice. it was a very long sort of thing as it started early afternoon and we were there until 2AM singing songs, she was playing guitar.
then we went to her house and hung out in front of it and in the bar next door and we talked until 5 in the morning and i found myself telling a lot of stories i wouldn't normally tell someone that doesn't know me very well. it was very nice. i like her a little a lot i think. i don't know which of the two, but whichever one is nice.
i will tell you more about it when we skype. because i have just realised we are about to have a skype call and i will talk about the same things i was going to write here... mmm.

well that's just the most recent thing on my mind. but there's all of my time in Rio which i need to talk to you about because there were some interesting bits and things.

I am looking forward to our conversation and I wish you could be here to hang out with me on the lovely terrace of this apartment and explore SÃ£o Paulo with me because it is an amazingly intricate and infinitely interesting city and it is so alive it's enthralling and thrilling and bodily-exciting.

And I have been breathing and living you. Thank you so much for your words. They have filled me with love and life and light and warmth. Thank you for writing to me even in my absence.

But fuck. Lately I have been obsessed with an idea that I cannot write speak see or generally feel the same way that I did in some past that's behind me and that I cannot get back to.
And that's why I didn't reply to you for such a lont time (this time did include varuiys failed attempts)

But then I serendipitously came across another Cummings poem, 

"since feeling is first
who pays any attention
to the syntax of things
will never wholly kiss you;"

Which basically just told me to shut up and stop thinking about the hows and correct whens and whys and just write to you because feeling is first. And so here I am writing to you. I'm sorry I can't be more sound, more present, more coherent, concrete, stable and eventually you're going to get sick of this and that scares me. But no matter to that, I will stop giving voice to these thoughts I will, I'm sorry. (I cannot stop with the sorry, it's unmutable).

It was so lovely to read about you, please do not stop doing that. I am in a similar place where I really need to focus and figure out what to do next (professionally). But I really don'y want to so it's been hard. I want a life of books and writing and films and travelling and I think I have told you this and its ridiculous I know.
Right at thsi moment, I don't want to make films. I don't even want to be involved in it. I just want to take it. It's very much like the fact that I don't want to speak, I just want to listen. I don't want to write to you, I just want to read you. I'm not sure what this means yet but I know that in at least one way, it isn't good at all. It is passive. And passive is not good. 
Life is creation. And creation is action. But then action can so easily become DO DO DO, which I cannot deal with. DO DO DO feels like an avalanche swallowing me up, a mountain crumbling on top of me. 
But I also know there is a big misconception in that rational link (like in most of the rational links I make in my head), I just need to break it and not see in that way.
Point is, I can't (or don't want to) DO DO DO.

I have just finished another job in TV and now I'm supposed to think about what to do next except I have no idea. I don't want to talk about it all but instead, I found a piece of paper on which I wrote some anxious thoughts a few months ago, and I it still resonates and I am going to copy it out o you because 
1. I think it might help me understand myself a little
2. you will understand how I generally feel about life at this point.
It was very relieving to find this piece of paper because I haven't been able to formulate opinions, logical thoughts about anything. So, this did it. So that's why I think copying it out might even be some sort of therapy - get my mind to itself.

This is it:

Sometimes I think I want to go to some sort of psych institution. Like I want to give up. But I don't.
And the clock is ticking and I'm 24 years old - how old was Winona's character in Girl, Interrupted?
Sometimes I think I'm never going to learn how to live in this world. I keep making the stupidest mistakes. There's practical things about practical life that I just don't understand. I thought that as I grew I would just grow into things. I would just grow into life, but it hasn't happened. 
And will I? And what am I supposed to do while I don't? And do I want to?
I don't think I do (want to grow into practical life)! But it would be so much easier if I did!
And yet as soon as I feel myself slipping into the steps of modern adult life I panic. I panic because I don't, I don't want to be part of this society - the one I was born into and find myself in right now - modern upper-middle-class.
And I fucking hate that part of me tells me I'm spoiled (feels spoiled) as I say this. Because that's the voice of the upper middle-class in me trying to say I'm ungrateful. I hate that fucking voice. (Now, this is not about money or status in society - I am talking about a whole mindset and way of living).
I hate this world around me.
I hate modern apartment buildings (stacked lives) and banks and talks about eh next car they want to buy. What the fuck is building credit at a bank? And now all of a sudden I need to start caring about it - BUT I DONT!!!
Intrinsically I don't, but am forced to care. I am forced to play. I am forced to think up a strategy. And I'm always gonna suck at this game because how good can one be at a game they don't like and don't care about? I only half-heartedly listen to the rules. 
I don't like any of the options given to me.
I don't like any of the characters I have been given to choose as my player in the game.
And then the dice is too heavy so I can't throw it.
I have made my own Frankenstein monster character to play the game, but it's like all the pieces I took from all the other characters are all of the weakest, most useless ones. My character does nothing in this game. It has no use, no special abilities.
It kind of knows who it isn't but it doesn't know who it is.
He's the weakest fucking player in the game.
And I don't know if I have been looking in the wrong places, but look at people, look at the world, there's no one really who I wish I could be.
I hate that maybe I sound ungrateful (in the spiritual, not material, sense) or lacking life, or love... But that's not it.
I know love.
I have been filled with beauty and wonder and life and love before so.... What is this?
I'm not sure.

The end.
There's a little bit of my mind, shared, with you.
I hate my current state of being.
Well.
Much love. For you - always.

I am living in a world that is so so surreal. I don't believe I am in it. It's a reality so disconnected from my previous reality that I can never actually believe it's real. And it never ever stops feeling temporary. I don't know if that means that I'm in the wrong place, that I don't want to stay, or if it just means that I know it's temporary.

I am shooting in the Brazilian countryside. In a gigantic farm from the 19th century, that used to have hundreds of slaves (the series takes place in the slavery period of Brazil). It's awe-filling. It's beautiful and tragic and sad at the same time. 

I'm working with a director that took me under his wing as his pupil, basically. He is teaching me so much. He is kind but hard at the same time. Not approachable at all unless he invites me in, which he does at specific times. He confides in me and I in him and it's refreshing and soothing and calming because I can be honest and he know that I'm not sure about anything. And he understands. But he still demands a lot of me, because he says while I'm there I have to be the best and I could be great.
I don't know.
It's weird. I have taken a gigantic step from the last job (I have been given all of the hardest shoots to do, together with this director, who is the main director - he chose me! i don't know why, how) ...and now all of a sudden I have been given so much responsibility and while I'm scared and think I can't do it people say I can and so I keep going and then people say I'm great.
I don't think I'm great. That's probably because I know that I don't know anything. That I don't even think I should be there! That I'm not sure about anything. But I don't know what to do.
For now I keep going.
I'm learning, I'm moving, I'm trying to understand... and I guess someday I'll get to where I'm going.

It's been weird on this job.
Within the space of 1 week, 2 of the guys who are in someways my 'bosses' tried to kiss me. Both of them married. 
One of them I would so certainly fall in love with, which was kind of happening until we kissed... But he's married and with kids and so there is nothing more to be said or done. He's one of the most intelligent and most interesting people I know. And there's an energy that is almost impossible to control that flows between us... but nothing more can be said or done.
And then now the production coordinator is -his words- falling in love with me. So it's actually become kind of annoying now because I just want people to stop mixing things up. Now I have to deal with this guy on a daily basis and he started treating me badly because I don't reciprocate his feelings... He had to apologise to me this week because of how bad it had gotten. 
And it's all so far from what love is.

I'm trying to think of how I could show you my reality and share this surreal world I am living in and I think the solution is to send you photos. Because I could not express in words. So I think that's what I"m gonna start doing. I don't even know if the number that I have is your number anymore? How crazy is that??
Basically. Everyday I put a pair of Timberland boots because we shoot in forests and lakes and beautiful middles of nowhere. I get bitten by millions of insects. I deal with and coordinate a lot of people who always have a lot of questions that I have to answer with great certainty (though I have none).
We've become like a family which is nice. Together all day, everyday.
And... I'm under constant stress that any of my answers or decisions is wrong and so I worry a lot in my life.
I dislike this level of responsibility profoundly.

Do you feel how stilted, how stiff my speaking has become?

I'm scared that I have changed so much. Though I don't feel I have. I'm scared that if we talk, that if I let you see me again, then you will realise that. And I don't know what that would mean. I'm scared of what that might mean. I know you don't want to talk about how things are between us, but I'm telling you this so that you know in all honesty how I feel, most truly. I think that's the only way I know how to communicate with you.

I love you always. Always.
One certainty amidst all of the uncertainties!

I'm going to this contact dance and improvisation workshop every thursday at Goldsmiths. I don't know if I ever spoke to you about contact dance but if you don't know what it is, maybe you should look it up but basically it's about sharing your energy core with someone through movement-- you share your weight and nobody leads the dance... The workshop I go to is more of an experimental creative gathering of sorts... The session lasts two hours and by the end of the first one I went there were people rolling on the floor in unison and on top of each other, people emitting ridiculous sounds and others playing instruments. There was a huge piece of paper on the floor and some were drawing abstract shapes and such. The last session we ended up in our improvised movement with each other in a circle surrounding a chic who has an enchanting voice and a boy repeating the "ohm" lying down on her lap, chanting in unison. 

It's about connection- it's about breaking down barriers and using each other as instruments to channel energies... It's one of the most amazing things I have come about lately... Today I went a photography exhibition in the morning at the photographer's gallery with my friend Pascal. There was sun and it's been rubbish weather for the past days and the cement was radiant. We had lunch that the Hare Krishna people serve near SOAS and fI went shopping in Camden on my own. I bought Frankincense, and then I went to the contact session.

I feel good- my dad came last weekend and we spent two days together- we're on good terms- he was happier with my state of being I think- he says I seem more "focused"- this consequentially lead him to be more accepting in a way of things I talked about and ideas that I was sharing with him- curiosity almost. 
I've had really interesting conversations with my various people lately on gender relations, queer theory, meditation, dreams etc. I posed nude for my friend's photo project (bea, do you remember), wearing my red doc martens (which I have cut up) and my aviator goggles in my room. She's done a series of portraits of various people in their rooms, naked-- trying to subvert the normative concept of sexuality and gender in nude photography... I think it's very interesting and I really like the pictures. 

I wish to talk to you- I wish I could share things with you every day like this and go to an exhibition and collaborate with you on a project. I miss you so much- I want to know about your every day life- I want to talk about books. 

I think of you. I love you. 
Now. I think, forever.

One day

The velvet of your lips. The dancing of your fingers, and the sound of your breath.

Sorry for having replied to his immediately! I was on my way to some night shoot I think. Maybe. I just remember being amazed at the fact that I had been thinking about you so much that day, more than normal.

And that first phrase - 'I am mastering my love for you and turning it inward as a constituent element of myself.' That has always been one of the greatest thing about you, your presence, in my life. 

What I feel - you - is a part of me and that is part of who I am. In short I'm just so grateful to feel what I feel and to have felt the things I've felt with you because... It permeated and permeates through everything around me. Who I am and what I see and feel.

You are everywhere all the time.
I carry it in my heart.

But back to more terrestrial points - the question you posed has been tormenting me. When will we see each other again? I don't know. Sometimes the thought is soul-crushing. I need to push it out of my mind.

I wish I could have even just one minute with you.

You're light, stars and moon; the breeze on a summer night; the sound of waves crashing onto land.

I have been speaking all day, literally all day- since 12 o clock yesterday morning to 3 o clock in the morning of today, to Matteo about his situation with Sofia. She broke up with him a few weeks ago, and he can't come to terms with why she is giving up on their relationship. We kept going in a loop about things, because I kept trying to convince him that his idea of love is distorted- that it takes two to tango as in, he is the only one willing to make steps to change things, and if she isn't, it means he simply needs to find another person that is and the she isn't to blame either- that there are different interpretations of what love is and it what measures it comes.... He kept saying that when someone really loves someone or something, whatever decision they make will always be on the basis of keeping that thing in your life. 

He kept asking me questions like "What if Babs said to you that now, in this moment, she wants to be with you and this means you giving up something else that you also want in order to be with her? Would you give it up or would you give up Babs?"  or telling me that one day I am going to find one person that I want to dedicate my lifetime to because I love them so much. It's almost as if he is not convinced that I love you, that I am in love with you because I still want to explore other people-- or because I haven't had enough experiences yet.

I don't agree with him. But the thing is, I just don't know. I'm losing track of what I believe in. Everything is becoming a doubt. Everything is potentially possible, because of the infinity of interpretations that exist within us. I am coming to the conclusion though that the relationships that we hold dear to our essence. It's as if we all had our own dimensions and when we share something with something else we share a dimension with them, which means inherently, that it is what defines us as well. And I know that the dimension that I share with you is the one I feel probably most secure in, the one I feel most myself, the one I feel is taking up the most space of my own personal, emotional dimension. So therefore, I ask myself a thing or two about us. This also on the basis as well of the problems and the pressure I feel from my dad right now because I am understanding that the dimension we share is coming out of focus, and it is the one in which I used to feel secure in, and maybe I am scared to know that I am the one to choose now. I am scared of the fact that I can even think or ponder these things, or give them so much importance... and even come to conclusions such as the open ended ones that I do come up with.

I need to speak to you and I need you in my life because you are the person I know I share a bigger dimension with, one in which I can identify myself in. Because these are the things that make us feel alive--- being able to interact and share our interpretation of the world with someone. Otherwise, if you do everything on your own and you make your decisions based only on what it is that you want, then nothing really has a value anymore.... I mean you have prescribed your own value to something or a decision but if you don't share it with someone, what's the point. It's like writing a fucking beautiful book and never sharing it with the world, in order to feed off it and create new things for other to feed off them. I don't know if this is all wrong. If I am just having one of the biggest experiences of existential paranoia I have ever had. As well as, I don't know if this how you view things as well, or if maybe I am just not making any sense whatsoever. But right now... I am losing that touch with you that I want in order to be happy, because I can be myself, entirely in the conscious and subconscious with you. And I am asking myself, now that I am coming to the point where all the decisions that include myself, such as where I am going after uni and if I want to break away from my dad and my family in a certain sense, because I couldn't possibly ever explain what I am explaining to you rigth now in the hopes that they would understand... I am speaking a different language and so now I am responsible entirely for defining who I am. 

And I feel like it's true. I don't know who the fuck I am, but I know that I want you to be part of that- or no- that YOU ARE part of me. But not in a selfish, or ego-ish way. In the way that every one of the people we know are parts of us. But you are a big part, and I'm starting to ask myself that maybe I want to start making decisions based on trying to be with you. Right now. Make those decisions on that basis. 

But at the same time, it all sounds ridiculous. 




Please, be honest and tell me if I sound deranged or if I am incoherent. But I am panicking. About all of this. I needed to write it down. 
I need to know your opinion on all of this, to understand whether it's all just a big knot of knots inside my head, that tomorrow will be strings or if it's something I, we, really have to talk about. 

I'm sorry.

The other day I was sat outside the NAB, smoking my I-don't-wanna-know-what-number cigarette... It was Tuesday, and it's my practice day and the class is definitely not as stimulating as it was last year. It's usually subdued. Tuesdays are very slow and very heavy for me.

You walked into my mind- literally walked into my conscious. I had a fucking stupidly big smile on my face. Babs, it's one of the first times I could feel your essence entirely embedded within mine. I was wondering what you were doing and I could feel your existence with so much fervour it scared the negative out of my being.

This moment was one of pure bliss and it is all thanks to your fucking magnificent presence in my life. You were- indeed- everywhere. You are- indeed- everywhere.

Yesterday instead, I walked around the city center with Mara, a new friend of mine. She's a fascinating creature- very quiet and reserved but has a rough edge that really stands out. Anyhow, we walked from Charing Cross into the art store we once went to, proceeded to ChinaTown and then visited the National Portrait Gallery. Nobody was particularly leading the trajectory but it happened to be chronologically in parallel with an evening I spent with you last year. I missed you so much I needed to almost throw up. I remembered the conversations we had in one of the rooms of the museum...the picture I took of you on the escalator on my wall (one of my favorites) and your words were still hanging to the atoms of the matter of the walls. 

It's beginning to hurt- your physical absence. I don't want to tell you to upset you. I just need to transmit to you this so very passionate longing I have for you in certain moments. Ti amo. Ti Amo. Ti Amo. 

But at the same time, thank you- thank you for having lifted my spirit on Tuesday. Thank you for us. Damn.

Hey my love

Love love love of mine. Excuse the gap between my reading and my replying to this. But be sure that when I read it my heart sank and skipped and my insides churned and sparked way too many times. So that I couldn't immediately reply. I needed time to digest. I don't like internet communication because it leaves no space... I think I am made for the letter-writing times because I need the spaces between things...

Anyway.

I don't think I can properly reply to you right now because too many things are happening and my head is in a million different places and hardly ever actually with me. But I wanted to say that any absence on my part does not mean that you are absent from my life, my conscience. I don't know. You're in my conversations with people, and the places I go to and the people I meet and the things I see. But I've already told you this too many times.

Particularly though, I've been entranced by a letter from Jean Paul Sartre to Simone de Beauvoir, who he was madly in love with his entire life. And well, though it might sound a little bit exaggerated it is nothing short of what I have always said to you. Just with even better words.

So in my own lack, here goes a truly deeply beautiful expression of the inexpressible:

âI am mastering my love for you and turning it inwards as a constituent element of myself. This happens much more often than I admit to you, but seldom when Iâm writing to you. Try to understand me: I love you while paying attention to external things. At Toulouse I simply loved you. Tonight I love you on a spring evening. I love you with the window open. You are mine, and things are mine, and my love alters the things around me and the things around me alter my love.â

I hope you don't misunderstand this 'you are mine.' This is 'you are mine' in this most free sense that any has ver had. The direct opposite of its literal sense, in fact. It is entirely personal and not at all to do with possession. If 'I am mastering my love for you and turning it inwards as a constituent element of myself' (which I think is one of the most beautiful things I have ever heard) means that this love something individual, personal, inside, and not at all to do with possession or reciprocation... 'you are mine' means the same thing. 

You are mine means my love for you is mine. And it changes everything around me. And it changes how I relate to people and my environment. And how I see the world. 

I guess maybe all that I want to say, out of this big jumble of words that is a mind in pieces trying to come together... I guess maybe what all of these pieces want to say is thanks for giving me the experience of this love. Whatever it is. This feeling that is unlike anything I have ever felt before, and truly close to something that is simply PURE. Which is so rare to find. Its beauty continually astounds me. So thank you.

And I love you.

I have something else to send to you, but I will do that later because this has gotten too dense.  If I have not managed to express what I think (or what I think that I think) I think this other piece will clarify it. Later.

For now just this.

Ps. I cannot indulge in memories. I try not to because I find it a little scary because I don't want to miss you too much. Just saying this makes me miss you too much.

Pps. I am sorry I didn't say anything about what you said to me. It is so nice to hear about you. I wonder how you are now... I do wish you were right next to me. I hope you are and feel found right now. That you have the grip that you want. But these words feel silly to write. I need to talk to you and hear your voice... I cannot write about myself for now. Now. I hope we talk soon.

I hope these words don't fall short of expectations. Mind... shattered. 

...ti amo sempre.

I think you are the only person in my life apart from my very sibling that I trust with all my heart. Truly. I suppose that is why. I explained all this to my dad to no avail, as he interpreted it as my thinking that I don't think many people in my life actually love me. I really don't like the way I am speaking (well.. writing) but I'll continue because I am on a bit of a roll, and please don't think that I am expecting a reply because all I want is to speak. Speak to you. Long nights in London await. I want to come back now. This vacation, or rather lapse in fucking time has lasted way too long! I feel in limbo once more, sort of like I did those last few days in London in June, but less desperate I suppose. 

I am also sort of afraid to come back to London. This is where my discussion with my dad comes into relevance. 
While we were speaking, I had a sort of revelation. I understand why my first time on acid was so fucked up as much as I understand a grand part of my social insecurities... or rather the underlying feeling of WRONG and TABOO in my doings at psy parties or in my hanging with people such as Lora (i am not explaining this the way it is in my head but I will continue anyways). It is because I have always had as a point of reference embedded within my fucking soul, I feel, my father's ideals/principles and ways of being. Example: when i was on acid at the squat rave, I didn't feel completely free, and I felt like I was not part of the together, simply because I knew that I was part of some other fucking world that lives underneath the theology of my father and the lifestyle that surrounds him.

This summer, specifically in Spain and at Ozora, I finally felt free of this fucking layer of wrong and not-part-of-the-togetherness feeling. 
I felt detached.

I just wrote a whole other paragraph explaining why I am afraid of going back to London but only now realizing how silly my worries are, and that I need to stop thinking so deeply about things because it leads to a benign superficial realm of thought. So I deleted it.

I'm sorry I am dumping this massive stream of thought into your mind's bowl, but I needed to tell you and I don't know why.

But this is also why I would like to speak to you because dialogue will help me feel less like I am dumping all my shit onto you and rather simply asking for your opinion on my infantry.

There are other things, but I really don't want to overwhelm you. They include the fact that mom is drinking again, and the other night when my father was telling me all these things I felt like I was a black body/essence being squashed by walls of rubber and you were the only person I knew would bring me back to peace again and I think that is why I needed to tell you all these things.

Hello hello my beautiful friend.
Here I am again. Having failed again at keeping in touch in a civilized manner.
The story is old by now so there is no point in telling it, and my hope is that you somehow telepathically and somewhat extraordinarily empathize with me and this stupid state of mind that I find myself in.
It's hard to write, this summer.
Extremely hard. I tried writing for myself and couldn't get past three lines. It's like pen and paper have matching magnetic poles and will.just.not.stick together.
I cannot write about myself, as I told you before. And thus I kept waiting for the time when I would be able to and it didn't come. So I'm wirting to you now and I don't know where it's gonna go.

First and foremost...
Thank you for your beautiful beautiful beautiful previous message. Reading it made my heart fill with joy in that way that only you can ever do.
I am happy that you liked my message. it was the least that i could when really i wished you were here so that i could hug. i'm happy i guess to have been able to transfer at least a fraction of that emotion to you. 
As always, I am perplexed by your fascination or love of my writing and I don't see how a person such as Michael (from what you've told me of him) would be fascinated by my words. I just don't see it! Especially these days, when the idea of writing scares me and I feel silly to even ever have contemplated having any sort of way with words. I don't know. I don't know...
But it makes me happy that you like it.
And thank you, thank you so much. it means so much. I love you.

And of course I know what you mean by being in love in the greater sense. I am in love with your soul too. Always have been! You beautiful thing!

Where are you now? Back in Rome or getting back this weekend? I have lost track of time. Strange.

Another reason I didn't write immediately is I think at the time that I read your message I didn't feel fit to write about what you said about your mother. And that saddens me so much because what am I here for if not for those moments? (again I ask you to inhumanly empathize and bare with me through this period... I am trying to become more present. get over the shit in my head. i promise!)

What you told me. about the phone call and divorce case deeply struck me. chilled me to the bone. I don't know but i think it's because i have been in similar situations. not with my mother but with my aunt in my dad's side of the family who never got over her divorce and went on to become dependent on anti-depressants and with a friend of my mom's that also went through the same thing, and then my mom's super rich friend in Rio who is rich but deeply superficial and deeply stuck on shallow things as if to replace something deeper that is missing. 
And i can only imagine how it must feel when it is your own mother... I remember the feeling that they evoked.. of spiraling down a black hole... dizzying and icy at the same time and the anger just plain anger at their not being able to get over it to get out of it to let go of meaningless things.
I don't know what to say.
How are you doing? How is she?
I'm sorry if writing about this has brought up things you had forgotten about. Don't feel that you have to reply necessarily.

I miss you.
I wanna talk to you.
When do you think might there be a possibility for a skype call?

Also, about what I was gonna send to you in the post. It's actually something I meant to send you last summer and I recently found it again in my things. But someone else is sending something to you. I don't know if you got it yet and I can't tell you 'cause it's a surprise, but I only decided to send what I had to send after this person wrote to me asking for your address so -  credit goes first and foremost to this person for being adorable and sweet. I suppose. I don't know what you're gonna think! Or what it is actually...

It feels like a sunday morning even though it's thurday and i've woken up in the midst of early morning darkness because of the feel of insects crawling on my skin and the confused sensation of cold chill and hot sweat.

It only seems and I suppose is the ideal time to answer your beautiful message as well as trying to pry some information about your life, right now- presently, out of you so that i can place you into  a colorful background into my head, in order to then transfer those colors into your own world which you define a "haze".

I read your message to michael. Well.. Parts of it anyhow. I am pretty positive it made my day as well as making my birthday in general. He was fascinated.

It reminds me of how in love I am with your soul, and in the greater sense of 'in love'... It exceeds that. You know what I mean... I hope.

I don't know what to do ( there isn't anything to do unfortunately ) and I am not so sure why I feel the need to tell you but it's taken up a lot of space in my head and incited angry vibes at the world and dependency and addiction and superficiality and all that constructs the plastic ceran wrap of shit that she's permanently wrapped herself in. She's been in the same loop of thoughts and events that repeats utself over and over... For the past four- five years now. Can't come out...

I am in a house in the middle of mallorca surrounded by mountains that recall an african savannah. The heat is smouldering but it doesn't matter because I have missed the sun so much this year I let it burn to make up for the absence. The house is owned by this individual < i don't want to say "guy" because he is not just any guy > called Michael who is originally from California but has lived here for hell of a long time. We have built a really intense relationship that kind of intimidates me but our converasations, shared also with this boy from boston, ricky, are making me grow so much. We have an "energy" that is reverberated between us and the projects of th house ( gardening, building, cooking etc.). 
Michael is a musician who collects things. So many things... Talk about fucking stuff man... You would love this place... You would definitely want to film something here. Old, tattered, miscelleanous, covered in dirt and dust but full of youth. I don't know how to explain in words . Something I have to explain to you in words and verbalise my feelings about this place and definitely the relationship that I have with Michael. He's fucking intense man. 

I don't have any plans for after this. I don't know what I am gonna do but I feel so at peace... Grow.

On a somewhat more relevant/important note- I am at the hotel. My sister and my mom are sharing a room and my gobrother/cousin/closefamilyfriend and I are sharing a room (his name is Henry. We have adjacent rooms as well as balconies, and they are constructed out of wood, light and kind of pale. Not the rustic feel, but the new wave rustic look, kind of feel.
The balconies overlook on this piazza, at its center this really magical statue/fountain construction, and there are two buildings with the same aura as the interior of the hotel. New wave rustic. Really slick, and the opposite of cosy. The entire town is kinds of like this, emanating the tirolese/austrian influence in the north. Back to the piazza: it's empty. Or rather, static. There is hardly any activity and every now and then there is a lone traveller making his way across it. It's fucking silent.
Ok, now. I am sitting in the balcony, really clean and really slick remember; really stoned. 

I am telling you all of this because- you know those moments in life (they're usually when you're on your own) when you feel like you are in a fucking movie scene. Ok imagine that feeling but times a bajillion. Almost, like you can convince yourself that you are starring in a movie, and your mind starts whizzing and you start contemplating the metaphysical phenomenon that you are at the center of the world and everybody in it is acting at your disposal. A huge experiment.
I'm straying from the point. 

I have sat on the damn terrace a number of times now and this feeling just comes on, all the time.
It's crazy and it's perfect at the same time. I need to draw it for you. It's a fucking film/ or a play honestly and there are three scenes already. Just imagine okay? Me sittin' there high (as per usual) contemplating things such as the egotistical thought I exposed to you previously. Second one, my personal favorite---> I am sitting there smoking a cigarette. And the shot would be taken as if you were looking onto the balcony from the outside but parallel. And out comes my god brother, who is quite a goofy character brushing his teeth with an electric tooth brush. He has a vacant look, he is wearing a white tshirt, skii pants and it's snowing. 
My mom suddenly comes into the picture in the terrace right next to ours. Smoking her own cigarette and fretting about her nose and about he skii lesson in the morning. Henry shrugs, goes back inside.

There is a last scene but to be honest I don't want to be too overwhelming, I don't know if I was really high or if all of this is fucking genius but you must see this setting. It's driving me nuts. 

I needed to tell you. Because I needed to record it, and for some reason I just felt like sharing this with you. For not particular rational reason.

so i came across this just now and it's a letter from father to son, and i don't know this Anderson guy but i'm copying and pasting it here with introduction and all so that you may understand. it s beautiful:

The quest to find one's purpose and live the creative life boldly is neither simple nor easy, especially for a young person trying to make sense of the world and his place in it.

In the spring of 1926, Sherwood Anderson sent his seventeen-year-old son John a beautiful addition to history's most moving and timeless letters of fatherly advice. Found in Posterity: Letters of Great Americans to Their Children (UK; public library), the missive offers insight on everything from knowing whose advice not to take to the false allure of money to the joy of making things with your hands:

...In relation to painting.

Don't be carried off your feet by anything because it is modern â the latest thing.

Go to the Louvre often and spend a good deal of time before the Rembrandts, the Delacroixs.

Learn to draw. Try to make your hand so unconsciously adept that it will put down what you feel without your having to think of your hands.

Then you can think of the thing before you.

Draw things that have some meaning to you. An apple, what does it mean? The object drawn doesn't matter so much.

It's what you feel about it, what it means to you.

A masterpiece could be made of a dish of turnips.

Draw, draw, hundreds of drawings.

Try to remain humble. Smartness kills everything.

The object of art is not to make salable pictures. It is to save yourself.

Any cleanness I have in my own life is due to my feeling for words.

The fools who write articles about me think that one morning I suddenly decided to write and began to produce masterpieces.

There is no special trick about writing or painting either. I wrote constantly for 15 years before I produced anything with any solidity to it.

The thing of course, is to make yourself alive. Most people remain all of their lives in a stupor.

The point of being an artist is that you may live.

You won't arrive. It is an endless search.

I write as though you were a man. Well, you must know my heart is set on you. It isn't your success I want.

There is a possibility of your having a decent attitude toward people and work. That alone may make a man of you.

âA rat-grey fungus, glutting on our cache.â
Iâm not interested in feeding the audience of these photos spoonfuls of a message they will pretend or want to relate to. Viewers are invited to feel (or not) disgusted or pleased with these images that are based on a poem by Seamus Heaney called âBlackberry Pickingâ; a literary piece that symbolizes (in my own interpretation) the decay of the positive and a downfall of hope. The persona is awaiting the pleasure of eating the abundant amount of blackberries that he has picked, and watches them rot. These pictures could be considered a continuation of Heaneyâs idea, and analyze the obsession that many individuals of this degenerated world have for auto-destructiveness. The taboo desire that nobody is inclined to admit they have with the many somethings that they are aware will taint their minds with negativity is the basis of my line of thought at the moment that these were shot.

Herman Hesse is so fucking good.
I haven't even read that much by him, but i went through a phase. i started reading Steppenwolf (Il Lupo della Steppa - i actually read it in italian) and i loved it but didn't finish it because something happened in my head and all of a sudden i decided that i didn't like reading in Italian unless that was the original language. (god this is a little glimpse into how my stupid mind works) so i put the book on hold, meaning to get an English copy of it soon.
i never did.
then i read Siddartha and i loved it of course.
and then i decided i loved Herman Hesse and he was probably THE author of my life.
and i decided i wanted to read more stuff by him BUT i also wanted to know more about him AND i wanted to be "prepared" to read his works... i knew they all contained laods of Eastern philosophy etc etc
so i went on to borrow a billion biographies and literary criticism books about him from the library.
i got through little bits from all of those...
and then never actually READ any more of his works because i got a little bit tired of the subject and also just didn't have time.

moral of the story: i spend most of my life preparing for things and finding excuses and not actually DOING them. for one reason or another. and i miss out a lot because of that. and i am trying to change that but i find it incredibly hard because i don't actually notice it while it's happening because it makes perfect sense in my head.

WOW.
sorry for that huuuge deviation.
my point is and all that i wanted to say was:
i will be so happy to talk about the book with you. and to read it. or have you read it to me.
and i love that you like him. i know it's stupid to have these little things matter but they do somehow. the fact that you like Herman Hesse makes me smile.

i will shut up now.
i'm sorry to once again making you read way too many words of my aimless ramblings.
i don't think i have the ability of distinguishing what's interesting from what's not, so please feel free to tell me.

i think the one good thing about this is that it has taken my mind off physically missing you
(but writing this thought out now has likely just brough it back)

good night...
xx

Isa Isa Isa my god I wish were there to be able to just go over to your house, give you a hug and take you somewhere, anywhere, with nobody else and therefore nothing to worry about... other than all the shit that goes through our heads, but if it were just me and you on the top of a building somewhere, we could work it all out. I would take out every single one of the worries in your head and show you that really everything is ok. If anything, even if things are shit, they are really actually ok because you have people to support you. And when you feel most utterly and life-haltingly alone, when even all the people you know you "have" feel too distant, I am actually there. Not distant. Not as distant as I might seem, like every other person seems to be because that is simply the nature of human existence - No. It doesn't apply in this case. You know that e.e. cummings poem:

i carry your heart with (i carry it in my heart)

Well, that's how I feel about the people that I care about most genuinely and wholly in my life. I can count them in one hand and I'll just tell you now - you're one of them. By some magic that I still have to figure out, you have carved out your own little corner inside of me, in the shortest and strangest amount of time. By strange I mean that it wasn't linear, because as linear time goes, things like this need a little bit more time to happen, at least with me. But time isn't linear anyway, is it? So really I have known you for centuries and centuries., in which case this is perfectly standard. 

So I carry your heart, I carry it in my heart and therefore you are a part of me, and being a part of me, you are never alone, because I care about you as much as I care about myself. I swear. It may not seem normal, natural, true or even possible, but it is. This is part of who I am and maybe you have figured it out by now - other people can many, many times come before me in my world. Usually that's a bad thing. In this case it isn't because it come from the fact that,

I carry your heart, I carry it in my heart.

We would be on a rooftop somewhere right now, and I would extract every single one of the worries in your head (the little bastards). Remove the treacherous, cancerous torments almost surgically, and we'd go through them one by one. Every. single. one. Because you are a part of me and so there is nothing, not one thing, that you would have to be ashamed of.

Well then finally, after this, which would be perhaps the most painful process, would come my favorite part and the whole point of this which would be that I would show, through whatever means necessary, that you are beautiful and perfect and everything is ok.
And now I am repeating this again, but everything is ok because even if it isn't, I carry your heart in my heart now and so you are never alone and if you are never alone then it's all ok. I wish I could explain but all I can do is repeat this! If you are not alone, truly not alone, then everything is ok. It's just... logical.

What I mean is, if you are not alone, then you can go through hell but you can always tell me. And telling me isn't like telling any person, because you are a part of me so there is virtually no judgement, just recognition and understanding. And by that I mean you can go be a prostitute right now because you can't be fucked to do anything else and though I would try with all my might to stir you away from that desolate path, I wouldn't look down on you.

I wish we could be on a rooftop right now because that helps get things back in perspective. You know, sometimes we go into the dark spaces and we start to see the world through a fisheye lens (it looks very cool in that Amelie film, but it's terrifying in real life, isn't it?). Things just look like they are all coming at you. And it doesn't just look like it - you feel it too. It's like your feelings become fisheyed... you know. Like they're all trying to eat you up. Like going through a haunted house (I think Amelie goes through one too, in the film)

We would be on that rooftop and from the rooftop you can start seeing things through a standard lens again. Reset. And also things look a lot more beautiful and a lot less harmful and you feel a lot stronger. And also there would be no one else, and so virtually no worry of judgement, but without being alone, which helps, too.

I wish that all of that were enough, but of course you would still worry about Rylie and your mother. 
(And not about being fat because I would take that away immediately because I would show you that you are beautiful because you are. You are one of the most beautiful people I know. Yes, because I know you 'inside' and all that schnazzle. But also because you are HOT I mean it man, I do. ...am I dying of embarassment right now? Yes... yes I am)
All those worries would be there but I would be there and you are a part of me, so that would make you feel stronger.
Because the weight of the world wouldn't be all on your shoulders. It isn't!
